column4: hi all, why would a mfgr put their printer userguide & driver disk on a cdfs filesystem disk? I had to compile support to read it.
CDFS is what basically ALL CDs use.
CDFS has been used since some time in the 90s, it was decided as a standard so all operating systems could read the disks without special drivers.
it was unreadable natively, after compiling cdfs module, the disk now shows a iso file. windows was reading it without a problem.
